hanzi-su-wiki:
唆

Значения

Завлекать, соблазнять

Мнемоника

Справа — злой, т.е. бурлак 夂, ограбленный злодеем 兇. Злые выкрики 口, подстрекать, науськивать. Элемент «злой» в современном написании неотличим от знака «медленная походка».
purpleculture_pinyin:
suō
to suck; to incite
сосать; подстрекать
rtega_mnemonic:
唆唆RSincite, instigate, tempt
  • mouth 口 making a man go slowly 夋: he's being tempted
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 夋 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
教唆 [ jiào suō ]: to instigate; to incite; to abet
挑唆 [ tiǎo suō ]: to incite; to stir up; to instigate
调唆 [ tiáo suō ]: to provoke; to stir up (trouble); to instigate
罗唆 [ luō suō ]: incorrect variant of 啰嗦
罗唆 [ luō suō ]: incorrect variant of 啰嗦
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 夋 [ qūn ] to dawdle; the emperor Yao's father
heisig_constituent: tempt, mouth, streetwalker, Ministry of silly walks, John Cleese, license, elbow, human legs, walking legs
koohiiStory1: I named the right part legal prostitute has it represents a walker [walking legs] with the license. It´s easy to imagine a legal prostitute tempting a man with her mouth.
koohiiStory2: Prostitutes in Amsterdam have a license to show off their walking legs and tempt customers with their mouths.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you have spiders in your mouth, then you're going to instigate fights between people. Mostly because the spider in your mouth makes you grumpy, but also because the spider keeps telling you to be an instigator with its little mouth inside your own mouth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having a spider in your mouth. Imagine being angry about it and instigating fights between people because of it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The spider in your mouth tells you to instigate a fight by sawing (さ) the other person's leg off. It even whispers where you can find a nice big saw.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the fight you and the spider instigated. The guy pointing at the saw, then pointing at his sawed off leg. Listen as the spider tells you to shake your head.
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 厶 (значок МУ), 口 (рот), 夂 (зима)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the mouth (口) has a license to go (夋) and he's tempted
humanum_full_description_en:
From " mouth ", "夋" sound. " Instigation " is a later word, and its original meaning is to instigate and encourage. "Zhengzitong. Mouth": "Instigation, and vulgar instigation. There is no instigation in ancient times, and it is commonly used." For example, Shi Naian's "Water Margin" Chapter 26 in the Yuan Dynasty: "How did you kick the Wu University afterwards? How to instigate the drug, Wang Po instigated and said it from beginning to end." Ming Dynasty Feng Menglong "Awakening the World Hengyan. "Prefect Qiao Ran Ran Pointing on Mandarin Duck Tree": "Li Du controls this to instigate the grandson's widow, Pei Jiu's family and Liu Bingyi.

"Langu" is the same as "Langu" and "Lasu", which means the language is trivial. For example, Chapter 51 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "You are old and don't go, our little master Luo (啰) insults, I'm afraid there is still something to say." Zhu Ziqing, "Children": "At the dinner table, you have to report to some classmates or About their parents."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " mouth ", the sound of "夋". " Instigation " is a later word, and its original meaning is to instigate and encourage.
humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「夋」聲。「唆」乃後起字，本義是教唆、慫恿。《正字通．口部》：「唆，又俗云使唆。古無唆字，通用嗾。」如元代施耐庵《水滸全傳》第26回：「次後來怎生踢了武大，因何說討下藥，王婆怎地教唆撥置，從頭至尾說了一遍。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．喬太守亂點鴛鴦譜》：「李都管本欲唆孫寡婦、裴九老兩家與劉秉義講嘴，鷸蚌相持，自己漁人得利。」

　　「囉唆」同「囉嗦」、「囉囌」，表示語言瑣碎。如《紅樓夢》第51回：「你老且別去，我們小爺羅（囉）唆，恐怕還有話說。」朱自清〈兒女〉：「在飯桌上，一定得囉囉唆唆地報告些同學或他們父母的事情。」
humanum_short_description: 從「口」，「夋」聲。「唆」乃後起字，本義是教唆、慫恿。

From " mouth", " 夋" sound. " Instigation" is a later word, and its original meaning is to instigate and encourage. "Zhengzitong. Mouth": "Instigation, and vulgar instigation. There is no instigation in ancient times, and it is commonly used." For example, Shi Naian's "Water Margin" Chapter 26 in the Yuan Dynasty: "How did you kick the Wu University afterwards? How to instigate the drug, Wang Po instigated and said it from beginning to end." Ming Dynasty Feng Menglong "Awakening the World Hengyan. "Prefect Qiao Ran Ran Pointing on Mandarin Duck Tree": "Li Du controls this to instigate the grandson's widow, Pei Jiu's family and Liu Bingyi. "Langu" is the same as "Langu" and "Lasu", which means the language is trivial. For example, Chapter 51 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "You are old and don't go, our little master Luo (啰) insults, I'm afraid there is still something to say." instigate

instigate
Name meaning
Encourage others to do bad things.
suō
I гл.
1) подстрекать, подговаривать, подзадоривать, науськивать, провоцировать, побуждать
唆狗咬猪 науськивать собаку на свинью (обр. раздувать чью-л. ссору)
2) сев. диал. обсасывать, всасывать
吃剩的桃核, 他又用嘴唆了一遍 оставшиеся персиковые косточки он обсосал еще раз
唆了一口烟 затянуться (табаком, сигаретой, опиумом)
II собств.
Со (фамилия)
Radicals: 口, 夋  (mouth, spider)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you have spiders in your mouth, then you're going to instigate fights between people. Mostly because the spider in your mouth makes you grumpy, but also because the spider keeps telling you to be an instigator with its little mouth inside your own mouth.
Imagine having a spider in your mouth. Imagine being angry about it and instigating fights between people because of it.
Reading Mnemonic
The spider in your mouth tells you to instigate a fight by sawing (さ) the other person's leg off. It even whispers where you can find a nice big saw.
Picture the fight you and the spider instigated. The guy pointing at the saw, then pointing at his sawed off leg. Listen as the spider tells you to shake your head.
